H0.text: The name of which Chinese dish translates as 'bits and pieces'. Chop Suey

H1.text: The name of which Chinese dish translates as 'bits and pieces'. Wonton Soup

H2.text: The name of which Chinese dish translates as 'bits and pieces'. Lo Mein

H3.text: The name of which Chinese dish translates as 'bits and pieces'. Zasui

A4.text: In newer Chinese-English dictionaries, the term za sui (杂碎) is listed with both meanings: cooked entrails, and chop suey in the Western sense.

A5.text: The anthropologist E. N. Anderson traces the dish to tsap seui (杂碎, 'miscellaneous leftovers'), common in Taishan, Guangdong (Toisan) – the home of many early Chinese immigrants to the United States.
